context.p: This task describes the task of replacing a car's radiator.

step.cmd: Drain the old radiator following these instructions.
Disconnect the radiator. Loosen the hose clamps and remove the hoses.
If the car's radiator has a transmission fluid cooler built in, disconnect the transmission line. Collect any transmission fluid and properly dispose.
Remove all harness connections for the electrical wiring. Disconnect the fan motor's electrical connector and any other electrical connections.
Remove the bolts from the mounting brackets.
Once it has been completely disconnected, remove the radiator from the car.
Dissamble the old radiator. Remove transferable parts like the fan shroud assembly and brackets before recycling the radiator.
Begin to install the new radiator. Connect any transferable parts to the new radiator.
Insert the radiator into the car. Be careful not to bend the fins of the radiator.
Connect the upper and lower hoses to the coolant reservoir. Slide the hoses onto their fittings, using channel locks to move the clamps into place.
Fill the radiator following these instructions.
